definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: If United fail at Anfield the league would be open for us.
sentences.chinese: 假如曼聯敗走安菲爾德，聯賽之門將會爲我們打開。

sentences.english: If Toyota loses China, its global position would be challenged.
sentences.chinese: 若豐田敗走中國市場，那會威脅其全球地位。

sentences.english: Oh, and it was sweet revenge for the defeat at White Hart Lane.
sentences.chinese: 噢，這也是對敗走白鹿巷一仗的一場很爽的復仇戰。

definition: to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph

pinyin: Ma3 si1 te4 li3 he4 te4

definition: to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
